turns.content:
Denver is the capital and most populous city of the U.S. state of Colorado. It is located in the South Platte River Valley on the western edge of the High Plains just east of the Front Range of the Rocky Mountains. The Denver metropolitan area has a population of over 3 million people, making it the 19th most populous metropolitan area in the United States.

Denver is known for its beautiful mountain views, cultural attractions, and outdoor recreation opportunities. The city is home to many professional sports teams, including the Denver Broncos (football), Colorado Rockies (baseball), and Denver Nuggets (basketball). It is also a hub for the arts, with a vibrant music scene, numerous art galleries and museums, and a thriving theater community.

The city has a strong economy, with a diverse mix of industries including healthcare, technology, finance, and energy. It is home to several major corporations, including the headquarters of DaVita, Chipotle Mexican Grill, and Liberty Media.

Denver has a semi-arid climate, with low humidity and moderate temperatures throughout the year. It is known for its 300 days of sunshine per year, making it a popular destination for outdoor enthusiasts. The city is also home to a number of ski resorts in the nearby Rocky Mountains, which attract visitors from around the world during the winter months.
